titles.title: Live Long and Prosper Act of 2000
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide tax incentives to enhance long-term care and to convene a National Summit on Long-Term Care, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the Committee on Ways and Means, and in addition to the Committees on Education and the Workforce, Commerce, and Banking and Financial Services, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

bill.summary: 5/18/2000--Introduced. TABLE OF CONTENTS: Title I: Tax Incentives to Enhance Long-Term Care Title II: National Summit on Long-Term Care Title III: Federal Outreach Efforts to Promote Long-Term Care Live Long and Prosper Act of 2000 - Title I: Tax Incentives to Enhance Long-Term Care - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow a: (1) deduction for qualifying long-term care insurance costs of a taxpayer and his or her spouse and children; and (2) personal exemption for certain elderly family members with long-term care needs residing in a taxpayer's home.Title II: National Summit on Long-Term Care - Amends the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 to direct the President to convene a National Summit on Long-Term Care.Title III: Federal Outreach Efforts to Promote Long-Term Care - Amends the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 to direct the Secretary of Labor to: (1) maintain an outreach program to promote financing and purchase of long-term care insurance by the American workforce; (2) establish a long-term care insurance Internet site.Authorizes appropriations for additional State outreach to seniors.Directs the Secretary of Health and Human Services to provide outreach on long-term care issues, including establishment of an Internet site.Amends the Social Security Act to require social security account statements to provide information relating to medicare, medicaid, and long-term care.
